items.title: Raspberry Car
items.description: Using only basic JavaScript code, node.js, socket.io, a Raspberry Pi and simple electronics, we were quickly able to gain control of a cheap radio controlled toy car with the use of our mobile device.
items.author: Eric Svensson

items.title: BLE Car
items.description: We hacked a remote control car replacing the radio controls with an Arduino micro controller so we could control the car from our mobile devices instead using low energy Bluetooth for communication.
items.author: Aaron Ardiri

items.title: Camera Remote
items.description: Controlling a camera from an Arduino micro-controller opens up a world of possibilities from advanced time lapse, nature shots, catching the cookie jar theif to astronomical photos via a telescope-mounted camera.
items.author: Andreas Lundquist

items.title: TI SensorTag Demo
items.description: The app connects to the closest SensorTag when started and displays readings for the different sensors. You can modify this example to do something interesting with the sensor values.
items.author: Mikael Kindborg

items.title: Elevator Remote Control
items.description: With the use of an Electric Imp, a simple electronic circuit and a simple mobile application developed with Evothings Studio, we can remotely call the elevator and unlock its doors.
items.author: Eric Svensson

items.title: Magic Stone
items.description: The app itself is a modification of the Texas Instruments TI SensorTag example app that comes with Evothings Studio. The accelerometer of the TI SensorTag is used to move an object on the screen.
items.author: Mikael Kindborg
